evidence: Clear separation of concerns with distinct layers: ingestion, transformation (silver/gold), orchestration, and rag
Data flows in a unidirectional manner from bronze (ingestion) to silver and gold (transformation)
Use of shared utilities in 'utils' directory supporting the layered structure
Presence of orchestration layer using Dagster to manage data pipeline workflows
Transformation layer uses dbt which implies a clear separation between data modeling and business logic
risks: Tight coupling possible through shared utility modules if not carefully managed
Layer transitions may become bottlenecks if not properly asynchronous
Risk of leaking abstraction between layers if boundaries are not strictly enforced
